text.headline: Welcome to my story map!
text.text:
My name is Pankaj Parmar. I have graduated with an MSc in Applied GIS from the University of Sheffield and a BA. Hons in Geography from the University of Delhi. I am fond of creating spatial datasets and creating cartographic maps. This story map reflect's my journey into the fascinated world of geospatial technology along with my career growth.

Have fun delving into my geolife 😊

text.headline: Introduction to Geography in Highschool
text.text:
My journey into the field of geography began in high school when I attended a virtual seminar organized by ISRO on cyclones and natural disasters. This event introduced me to the important role of maps and raster data in geological research and hazard management, sparking my interest in pursuing a career in this field.

Initially, I viewed geography as a theoretical subject that often put me to sleep during lectures in 8th grade and resulted in academic struggles. However, after the impactful seminar, my perspective shifted, leading me to delve deeper into the subject. As a result of my newfound passion for geography, I achieved an impressive score of 97/100 in Geography during my 12th standard exams, which ultimately facilitated enrollment at one of India's top universities for geography.

text.headline: My FIrst Three Years with GIs
text.text:
After enrolling in Delhi University for BA. Hons, I experienced a delay in admission due to documentation issues, which led to a struggle finding accommodation near my college. As a result, I spent 6 hours (220Kms) traveling each day and had to study while commuting on public transport during my first year. Despite these challenges, it was during this time that I delved into Cartography and theoretical GIS.

In my second year, the situation improved when I rented a flat with some of my classmates, putting an end to the lengthy daily commute. It was also at this time that Practical GIS turned out to be even more intriguing than expected. The aspects involving satellite imagery and aerial photography captivated me especially; it was then when I created my initial geospatial map using GIS on NDVI and NDBI.

From thereon, spatial visualizations became one of my main areas of focus as I extensively worked with raster datasets on QGIS, making significant progress with various analyses whose results were employed in multiple research projects throughout university. During the three years of studying towards graduation, I dedicated myself largely towards leveraging geospatial tools for environmental understanding as well as crafting relief management strategies against natural disasters and climate change

text.headline: My Post Graduation In GIS
text.text:
After getting introduced to the world of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and mapping, I found myself fascinated by the endless possibilities and potential that spatial science holds for the future. With a deep desire to be a part of the innovative era in GIS, I made the decision to pursue a Master's degree in Applied GIS at the prestigious University of Sheffield.

My academic journey at the University of Sheffield was nothing short of transformative. I was immersed in a world of cutting-edge technology and cutting-edge ideas, where I had the opportunity to explore and experiment with different GIS tools and software. I spent countless hours refining my skills and honing my craft, developing a proficiency in tools such as QGIS, ArcGIS, and Google Earth, among others.

One of the highlights of my time at Sheffield was the project I undertook to create a navigational online map using MapBox. It was a challenging yet rewarding experience, as I had to incorporate various data layers and interactive features to create a user-friendly and informative map. In addition to working with mapping tools, I also delved into the world of 3D spatial modeling with Blender and Aerialod. This was a whole new realm for me, and I found myself captivated by the endless possibilities that 3D modeling presented. I spent hours experimenting with different techniques and styles, pushing the boundaries of what was possible in spatial modeling.

Furthermore, I had the opportunity to work with sophisticated spatiostatistical analysis techniques such as interpolation, network analysis, and mosaic analysis. These techniques allowed me to uncover hidden patterns and trends in spatial data, helping me develop prediction models and inform decision-making processes. I was amazed by the power of spatial analysis and its ability to transform raw data into meaningful insights.

text.headline: Research Projects
text.text:
Some of the projects I've worked on during my coursework:

  • Do Geotagged Tweets Hold the Key to Predict Local Elections (2023) in the West Midlands via Sentiment Analysis? (Python, deep learning, geospatial sentiment analysis)
  • Visualising Spatial Data with Open Source Platforms. (QGIS, MapBox, Aerialod, Google Earth Engine)
  • Identifying the intensity of road accidents in UK. (Python packages)
  • Child food poverty and maternal education; a statistical analysis. (R Studios, MS Excel)
  • Habitat Expansion Analysis of Wythenshawe’s woodlands for Lesser Spotted Woodpeckers as a GIS Consultant. (ArcGIS Pro, Least cost connectivity model)
  • Urban micro climate analysis. (ArcGIS Online, Kestrel weather logger, Bad Elf GPS receiver, ESRI Field Maps)

text.headline: Work Experience
text.text:
As an international student starting his new life in an unfamiliar country I encountered many challenges and one of them was to find a job however with my hard work and perseverance I was able to grab an opportunity to work with Dr Rae in Automatic Knowledge Ltd. as a Geospatial analyst. This job came to me as a blessing and I was able to grow my skills and problem solving approach in a professional setup. My internship started during January, and throughout my internship period, I worked on various spatial data archives, client projects and conducted spatial analysis in the field of transportation, healthcare, environment and sustainability.

During my work tenure my main duties involved:

  • Management of company data archives
  • Creation of new geospatial datasets
  • Conducting analysis on client reports
  • Spatial analysis and cartographic visualisations
  • Assisting in training sessions for consultancy firm
